laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive for intra-erythrocytic inclusions consistent with Babesia and positive for B. microti DNA by PCR. Parasitemia was 0.3%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: One month later, developed worsening hemolytic anemia with a Babesia parasitemia of 0.3%.
Normalized shortly before B. microti DNA was non-detectable by PCR.

laboratory_examinations.date: At conclusion of 6 weeks of ATV/AZ treatment
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Negative at 60 and 102 days after initiation of a four-drug regimen.
